pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:5.1: 14. The second training rule on loud noises
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were being noisy while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:7.2: “‘I will not be noisy while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not be noisy.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes loud noises while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk14:10.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
